p: The relationship between presence probability of P. tenuifolia and precipitation in the warmest quarter ( Fig 3a) showed that when the precipitation was below 23 mm, the presence probability of finding P. tenuifolia was less than 5%. When the precipitation in the warmest quarter ranged between 148 mm and 512 mm, the presence probability was higher than 50%. Precipitation in the warmest quarter from 148 mm and 512 mm might be effective predictor for modeling the potential distribution of P. tenuifolia.
